document_data.name: Two Stars
document_data.caption: A map showing Two Stars near the Lake of Tears.
document_data.mainbody: '''Two Stars''' was a crossroads town in [[Thesk]] within [[Northeast Faerûn|northeastern Faerûn]]. Laid at the intersection of the [[Cold Road]] and the [[Golden Way]],{{cite book/Unapproachable East|174}} more trade passed through Two Stars than anywhere else in [[Thesk]]. In {{yearlink|1497}}, Two Stars remained a crossroad of trade, still trading with [[Kront]]{{cite book/Forgotten Realms Campaign Guide|134}} and with [[Mulsantir]].{{cite book/Forgotten Realms Campaign Guide|168}}
document_data.Geography: Two Stars was {{SI|2000|feet|long=yes}} above sea level.{{cite book/Unapproachable East|171}}
document_data.Government: Lady [[Yolatir Gallidy]] ruled the city from at least {{yearlink|1372}}{{cite book/Lady of Poison|48|6}} Her general style of rule did not involve sticking her nose into anyone's business, unless someone got hurt. As of {{yearlink|1373}}, she was ferociously fighting the [[Shadowmasters]] of [[Telflamm]]. She financed her government by charging 1% of the value of any cargo brought into the city by wagon, a tax entirely paid by traders. She was a guild favourite.

Structures.Castle Gallidy: The residence of the Gallidy family was a castle literally in the middle of Two Stars; both the [[Golden Way]] and the [[Cold Road]] crossed its gates in both directions. The crossroads lay in the middle of the courtyard.
Structures.The Crossroads Inn: The first construction by [[Prasso Gallidy]], the founder, it sat on the northwest corner of the crossroads inside Gallidy Castle's main courtyard.
Structures.Thayan Enclave: The Thayan Enclave in Two Stars boasted the lowest prices anywhere outside of [[Thay]] itself. Though permission to build inside the walls was rejected, Lady Yolatir ultimately agreed to let them build, given the bargain prices they offered.
Structures.The Seer's Eye: This storefront had several adventurers offering their services as spell users. They included clerics both evil and good under the proprietor, a former [[red wizard]] named [[Hamal Kom]]. Most of their business involved [[divination]] spells regarding the crossing of the [[Endless Wastes]].
Structures.Ususi Manaallin's Home: The [[deep Imaskari]] [[wizard]] [[Ususi Manaallin]] had a laboratory in the city. It was hidden from view down a tight alley, its dome slightly protruding from beneath an unkempt grassy courtyard. Near it, broad stone stairs descended nine steps to a door. The dome was full of holes, which allowed sunlight down into the room. The structure had its inner walls lined with bookshelves, a desk in the middle, and numerous strange objects were hung from the ceiling.{{cite book/Lady of Poison|49-51|6}}

document_data.Temples: The only temple of note, that wasn't kept by a single priest attending only to the faithful, was a temple to [[Shaundakul]] built by [[Shanton Gallidy]], the Lady's cousin. Despite the community's size, the temple was the largest in the East.
